top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Worlds’s 150-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Racing Gravel Worlds isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gravel Worlds’s nebraska farm gravel, minimum maintenance roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Every session at Gravel Worlds intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Gravel Worlds rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Gravel Worlds’s classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 150 miles, Gravel Worlds rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Worlds when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Worlds. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Worlds — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Worlds — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel Worlds’s classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads delivers on race day.

race_overlay.heat: August in Lincoln, Nebraska (Sandhills Global Event Center) — August brings humidity, heat, and the kind of Midwest summer that tests your heat tolerance. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Gravel Worlds — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Heat index can exceed 100°F; Humidity is brutal.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Worlds requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads to build confidence. Expect: nebraska farm gravel, minimum maintenance roads, rolling terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 150 miles of classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads in Lincoln, Nebraska (Sandhills Global Event Center).
